item.title: Exploration of business systems in Asia
item.description:
Source: OUP. “The Oxford Handbook of Asian Business Systems”, edited by Michael Witt and Gordon Redding, is the first publication to examine business systems from India to Japan. Oxford University Press, the book’s publisher, states that existing research on “varieties of capitalism” (VOC) and “comparative business systems” heavily emphasizes Europe, Japan, and Anglo-Saxon countries. This book is the first to offer a thorough analysis of the institutional frameworks of most Asian countries and assess the applicability of current theories within the Asian context...

item.title: A book comparing Asian data privacy laws to international standards is available
item.description:
Graham Greenleaf’s Asian Data Privacy Laws: Trade & Human Rights Perspectives (ISBN 978-0-19-967966-9) is a groundbreaking examination of data privacy legislation across Asia. Source: OUP. Professor Greenleaf, a Law Professor at the University of New South Wales, Australia, and Co-founder and Co-Director of the open-access Australasian Legal Information Institute, explores 26 countries and individual jurisdictions. The book provides a thorough analysis of the 14 jurisdictions with specific data privacy laws, comparing them to global benchmarks...
